answers.answer: I have gd. A lot of times your blood sugar levels can be controlled with diet and exercise some people need medication to help stable their blood sugar. I check my blood sugar 4x's a day once in the morning and then 1 hr after each meal. Part of the diet is watching how many carbs you eat but it's also about balancing your carbs with protein. Your suppose to eat 3 small meals and 3 snacks a day. Your Dr will give you more in depth info when you go for your appointment.  Hope this helps
They told me u have it also. But since I've received my meter my numbers are always intact so idt I really have it.
I have GD and all I can say is I hope I deliver early :-( because im just gaining too much weight. But as the post above says that is a better way to go.

I had it with my last pregnancy and kept track of it by checking my blood sugar and dieting. It went away after I had my daughter. I did my glucose test today and I'm assuming I might have it with this pregnancy as well.

Thanks for responding.  I don't even do large meals or unhealthy meals. I love fruits and veggies. I'm 27 weeks , 28 tomorrow and this whole pregnancy I haven't been able to hold much down other than fruit. I have yet to even gain a pound(baby measures perfect tho). They had me take the test 3 (due to having diabetes in my fam) different times amd this is the first to say I have it.  I'm just shocked at the way I found out and the fact that now I have to see some stranger specialist and  I can't see my doc who I have seen for years.

Use the food list from Atkins. It will help control your hunger and stabilize your blood sugar. I wouldn't follow the diet until after birth. But the site has lots of delicious recipes that will satisfy you. I use the list as a guideline when I go shopping.

question: I'm so upset. I took my 3hr test on Monday and a few minutes ago recieved a phone call from the hospital I am suppose to deliver at about a appointment for next week that I had no idea about. I call back and she tells me it's for my gestational diabetes. GESTATIONAL DIABETES?!!! No one informed me! So I call my doc and the nurse is so apologetic that I found out that way. That they were planning on calling me, but they were so busy. She then informs me that I will no longer be seen by my doctor who I saw with my previous two pregnancies and have been seeing for 9 years! This stinks all around! I can't even describe how upset I am. Does anyone have GD, can they give me advise?
title: glucose results :(
